trans-unit.source: How to Create an Azure Virtual Machine with the Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Create an Azure Virtual Machine with the Azure CLI | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to install the Azure CLI on any platform, how to use it to connect to your Azure account, and how to create a VM from the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to install the Azure CLI on any platform, how to use it to connect to your Azure account, and how to create a VM from the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: Creating a VM by using the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)
trans-unit.target: Creating a VM by using the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)

trans-unit.source: The Azure CLI is a great way to manage your Azure infrastructure from any platform.
trans-unit.target: The Azure CLI is a great way to manage your Azure infrastructure from any platform.

trans-unit.source: Only installing the Azure CLI and having an Azure subscription will prevent you from creating a VM immediately, so let's take care of those steps.
trans-unit.target: Only installing the Azure CLI and having an Azure subscription will prevent you from creating a VM immediately, so let's take care of those steps.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure account, [go get a free one](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure account, [go get a free one](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: Installing the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Installing the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions for [installing the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli.md#install).
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions for [installing the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli.md#install).

trans-unit.source: Connecting to Azure by using the Azure CLI
trans-unit.target: Connecting to Azure by using the Azure CLI

trans-unit.source: You can connect your Azure CLI installation with a personal Azure account, or with a work or school Azure account.
trans-unit.target: You can connect your Azure CLI installation with a personal Azure account, or with a work or school Azure account.

trans-unit.source: To understand the differences and choose, see [How to connect to your Azure subscription](../xplat-cli.md#configure).
trans-unit.target: To understand the differences and choose, see [How to connect to your Azure subscription](../xplat-cli.md#configure).

trans-unit.source: Creating and connecting to a VM in Azure
trans-unit.target: Creating and connecting to a VM in Azure

trans-unit.source: Creating a VM starts with choosing (or uploading) an image and using the `azure vm create` command.
trans-unit.target: Creating a VM starts with choosing (or uploading) an image and using the `azure vm create` command.

trans-unit.source: To choose an image from the command line, you can list the available VM images by using the command `azure vm image list`.
trans-unit.target: To choose an image from the command line, you can list the available VM images by using the command `azure vm image list`.

trans-unit.source: Because there are so many images, you'll want to page the results by using `more` or filter by using `grep` (Linux) or `findstr` (Windows).
trans-unit.target: Because there are so many images, you'll want to page the results by using `more` or filter by using `grep` (Linux) or `findstr` (Windows).

trans-unit.source: For example, if you're looking for Ubuntu images on Linux, use a command like this:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you're looking for Ubuntu images on Linux, use a command like this:

trans-unit.source: This would still result in a long list of images, which you could further narrow down by version:
trans-unit.target: This would still result in a long list of images, which you could further narrow down by version:

trans-unit.source: From here you can choose an image and use the `show` command to view its properties in more detail:
trans-unit.target: From here you can choose an image and use the `show` command to view its properties in more detail:

trans-unit.source: Once you have chosen a VM image, use the `vm create` command to create the image.
trans-unit.target: Once you have chosen a VM image, use the `vm create` command to create the image.

trans-unit.source: This command has a lot of options, which you can list by using the `help` command:
trans-unit.target: This command has a lot of options, which you can list by using the `help` command:

trans-unit.source: Along with the image from step 1, the key arguments you need to create a VM are location, DNS name, and user name.
trans-unit.target: Along with the image from step 1, the key arguments you need to create a VM are location, DNS name, and user name.

trans-unit.source: For authentication you can choose to specify a password (on the command line or interactively), or to authenticate by using a certificate.
trans-unit.target: For authentication you can choose to specify a password (on the command line or interactively), or to authenticate by using a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you choose a password, it needs to be at least 8 characters, contain both uppercase and lowercase letters, and contain a special character (e.g. one of !@#$%^&+=).
trans-unit.target: If you choose a password, it needs to be at least 8 characters, contain both uppercase and lowercase letters, and contain a special character (e.g. one of !@#$%^&+=).

trans-unit.source: It's a good idea to put the password in quotes and escape special characters if you're passing it on the command line.
trans-unit.target: It's a good idea to put the password in quotes and escape special characters if you're passing it on the command line.

trans-unit.source: To choose a location, you can use the `vm location list` command to pick a region near you.
trans-unit.target: To choose a location, you can use the `vm location list` command to pick a region near you.

trans-unit.source: The DNS name you choose needs to be unique (it will map to `dnsname.cloudapp.net`), and will be the same as the machine name if you don't specify a machine name on the command line separately.
trans-unit.target: The DNS name you choose needs to be unique (it will map to `dnsname.cloudapp.net`), and will be the same as the machine name if you don't specify a machine name on the command line separately.

trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Let's go do something with your VM.
trans-unit.target: Let's go do something with your VM.

trans-unit.source: Since the example above opened the default SSH port, connecting to the VM once it's up and running is straightforward.
trans-unit.target: Since the example above opened the default SSH port, connecting to the VM once it's up and running is straightforward.

trans-unit.target: A great place to see more examples of using the Azure CLI to manage your Azure infrastructure is [the Azure CLI command reference page](../virtual-machines-command-line-tools.md).
